definition: to bind/bunch/bundle/classifier for bunches, bundles, beams of light etc/to control

sentences.english: Tie up the white plastic cloth of double claw and wing.
sentences.chinese: 束缚着双爪和翅膀的白色胶布。

sentences.english: At the same time, this fact fetter the trick of the judicial authority, indulge the criminal.
sentences.chinese: 同时也束缚了司法机关的手脚，造成宽纵罪犯的后果。

sentences.english: Gluons can form bound states called glueballs through self-interactions of gluons.
sentences.chinese: 由胶子通过自相互作用而形成的束缚态叫胶球。

sentences.english: The mean first-passage time of the Brownian bound oscillator is obtained.
sentences.chinese: 求出了布朗束缚振子的平均第一通过时间。

sentences.english: Restraint is necessary counter-part to the winds of opposition.
sentences.chinese: 逆风而行时，束缚是不可或缺的。

sentences.english: Internet era, weaks the restraints of the above factors.
sentences.chinese: 互联网时代的来临，弱化了上述的束缚因素。

sentences.english: Shackle Undead now costs 9% of base mana.
sentences.chinese: 束缚亡灵现在消耗9%的基础法力值。

sentences.english: Imagine, these lowdown Southern segregationists put the Northern Democrats down.
sentences.chinese: 设想，南方隔离主义的内幕束缚北方民主党。

sentences.english: An electron is by some means removed from the most tightly bound state of motion.
sentences.chinese: 用某种方法把一个电子从束缚最紧的运动状态上移走。

sentences.english: If you pursue an end, you enchain yourself.
sentences.chinese: 若你极力追求某种目的，你只会束缚了自己。

sentences.english: Elsewhere, they may be tethered at stanchions .
sentences.chinese: 在其他地方，它们可能都被束缚在支柱上。

sentences.english: You escape the bondage of life forever.
sentences.chinese: 永远逃离了生命的束缚。

sentences.english: That is to say it is confined to the atom.
sentences.chinese: 也就是说电子会被束缚在原子内。

sentences.english: In wrap restraint stress rats , both defecation and colon transit increased. Guanylin contents in plasma and colon increased too.
sentences.chinese: 束缚应激大鼠血浆及结肠组织中鸟苷素的含量增加。

sentences.english: Custom hedged him in and made him helpless.
sentences.chinese: 习俗束缚了他，使他无法可施。

definition: to throw off/to struggle free of/Taiwan pr. [zheng1 tuo1]
cage/trap (e.g. basket, pit or snare for catching animals)/fig. bonds (of wrong ideas)/shackles (of past misconceptions)/to trap/to shackle
to separate oneself from/to break away from/diastasis (medicine)/abscission/abjunction (botany)
to break away from/to cast off (old ideas etc)/to get rid of/to break away (from)/to break out (of)/to free oneself from/to extricate oneself
to eliminate/to do away with/to get rid of
to stand aloof/to be detached from/to transcend worldliness/untrammeled/unconventional
